summary: This bill, the Training Aspiring Leaders Emerging Now To Serve Act (TALENTS Act), establishes and details the Presidential Management Fellows Program. It outlines program administration, including the responsibilities of the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, agency processes, eligibility criteria, selection procedures, appointment terms, required development activities (such as training and mentorship), and conversion to the competitive service. It also addresses movement between agencies, withdrawal/readmission, removal/reduction in force, and the role of Federal Executive Boards in supporting the program. The bill aims to attract outstanding individuals to federal service leadership and management roles.
